page.title: 04FANSHAW HOUSE,BRICKENDON
page.content: In 1855 Mr Henry Saunders,fearful that should he die in bed the spiral stair_ case of his home would be too narrow to accommodate a coffin, decided to build a new home. This was Fanshaws set in 270 acres, a Jacobean style red brick house, with 12 bedrooms & servants quarters. Ironically Mr Saunders died of a heart attack in Bayford church in 1888! In 1912 the house was extended & remained a family home until 1962. Since 1963 it has been the offices of the Institute of the Motor Industry & its preservation & maintenance is ensured. 28 are employed there. On 12th June l985 a garden party was held to celebrate both the centenary of the motor car & the house itself. 400 guests enjoyed a unique display of vintage and modern motor vehicles,with music by the band of the 1st Queens Dragoon Guards!
